properties.areaDesc: Cuyama Valley; San Luis Obispo County Mountains; Santa Barbara County Mountains; Antelope Valley; San Luis Obispo County Interior Valleys; Ventura County Mountains; Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 1 at 7:17PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
A cold air mass will spread over the area Sunday night behind a
cold front. Overnight low temperatures will fall to levels well
below normal for this time of year. Temperatures in the teens to
low 20s will be common across the interior valleys and in the
single digits to teens for the mountains, especially Monday night
when the winds associated with the cold front are weaker. There is
a chance that some higher mountain valley locations could see
temperatures drop to around zero late Monday night and Tuesday
morning.

Temperatures this cold could burst exposed pipes outdoors or pipes
in poorly insulated structures, and cause a threat to life for
people, pets, or livestock outdoors for an extended period of
time. Residents living across the interior portions of the area
are advised to take action to protect their property in advance of
this cold air mass settling into the region Sunday night. Plan any
outdoor work being performed during the overnight or early morning
hours for the warmer parts of the day Sunday through Tuesday.

NWSheadline: COLD OVERNIGHT TEMPERATURES EXPECTED SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE INTERIOR VALLEYS AND MOUNTAINS
